About
Services
What can't we do for you? Ten Forward is a full service technology firm. We can help your existing team hit a critical goal or fix a process that isn't working. Need an app to expand your business to mobile users? That's our specialty. Don't have a team? No problem. Our team of outstanding engineers and creative designers can bring your idea to life. Even if you just need someone to make sure everything keeps running while you figure out which way to go, Ten Forward can be your guide to the next level.
Consulting
Web
Mobile
Process

You may have worked with other developers in the past, or this may be your first software project. Ten Forward Consulting practices agile development and primarily runs projects in 1-2 week sprints. We work with your team to identify a backlog of issues (user stories), bugs, and improvements - that need to be implemented and monitor our progress against that backlog during our sprints. This helps create an easy, reliable method of estimating development speed and expectations for future sprints. The 2-week cycle also has an advantage of keeping expectations in line and providing feedback to ensure everyone is always on the same page.

Brian Samson

Brian has over 15 years of software development experience and over 10 years experience developing mobile applications. He started Ten Forward consulting in 2012, after years as a successful freelance technology consultant. His passion for mobile software started in 2006 while working on cutting edge location-based services for Blackberry and other Java-based mobile devices, and he began developing for iPhone and Android as soon as they were released.

Brian and his team have worked with iconic companies like Burger King and Morgan Stanley on customer facing mobile applications. He has also helped startups located both in Silicon Valley and across the country raise over $25M in funding. Brian’s attention to detail and keen focus on the customer experience have established him as a leader in his field.

Brian also heads Madworks, a coworking space in Madison, WI. Brian took the reigns when Madworks merged with the University Research Park, a nonprofit focused on technology and real estate development and commercialization that benefits the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Under his leadership, Madworks has grown to capacity and become a community center for local entrepreneurs hosting meetups, hackathons, and Madison’s annual Startup Weekend event. Brian has also worked with community leaders to establish the Madworks seed accelerator which provides grants, mentoring, and access to second level funding for early stage companies.

X
Twitter: @bhashtagmoney
Brett Samson

Standing six feet tall, Brett is 72 inches of pure awesome (note: add another 4-5 inches of awesome if you want to count his beard). Before coming to Wisconsin to work with his brother in 2012, he had already been developing software for more than four years. Brett originally discovered his love for computers and programming early in life and continued by studying computer science at Dakota State University. Today, still residing in Madison, he extends his talents to the Ten Forward Team and its respective clients.

Outside of work, Brett enjoys branding Orcs, playing paintball, and watercolor painting. Like the rest of the team, Brett is a master Minecraft player and has aided in the pillaging of numerous villages but has also built for fair and just ruling.

X
Kyle Hanstad

If we can’t do it, Kyle can. From managing clients, to paying impeccable attention to deadlines, to writing professional copy at the snap of a finger, Kyle is truly a “do-it-all” kind of guy. Despite entering the workforce with a B. S. of General Engineering, he found that project management would be a better fit for him. He met Brian while playing a sand volleyball game, and soon joined Ten Forward’s emerging professional team (as for the volleyball team, we’re not sure). He said, “Ciao!” to Chicago, where he lived while attending the University of Illinois, and trekked further north to Madison, WI. Here, he happily continues his obligatory Chicago Bears fanhood and plays competitive indoor soccer.

“I enjoy working at 10FW because we strive to write the best web & mobile apps for our clients, and we get it done in a fun, relaxed environment.”

Kyle would spend his dream day fishing, camping, and playing music with his friends and family in the great outdoors. However, in the dreadful midwestern winter, this dream day might more so resemble a cozy day at home laughing at G.O.B. and his mandels on Arrested Development.

X
Twitter: @ZachBoatrite
Zach Boatrite

Zach is a developer with an innate sense for fashion. Although the fashion model of the office, Zach has proven his talent for developing through his extensive client work and experience in innovative design and production for all types of clients. Since joining the Ten Forward team early in 2013, Zach has become an integral part of the team and has become an expert in web development and plans to grow to encompass more aspects of the business as the company continues to grow in the future. Zach graduated from UW - Madison with a B.S. in Mathematics in 2013 and joined the team shortly thereafter.

Outside of working hard on development with the Ten Forward team, Zach is an avid camper, loves listening to music, and continuously thinks about how he can better use his free time.

X
Twitter: @sophcatherinee
Sophia Allen

Sophia really does love to use her range of interests to the advantage of her teammates. She holds a B.A. of Communications from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. This path allowed her to explore her interests of film, web studies, and media production while also indulging heavily in not-so-practical subjects like ancient Greek lit, ballroom dancing, and 19th century New York authors. She enjoyed wearing many hats in her schooling (as well as shoes, sunglasses, and coats), and is ecstatic to have been welcomed into a company that allows her to do the same professionally. Her favorite thing about working at Ten Forward is how open, accepting, and flexible the team is (also hilarious).

If you spy on her right before she falls asleep, you might find her reading Harry Potter or books about vitamins. Realistically, she’ll be watching her favorite television shows: The Office, Wild Russia, Friends, House of Cards, or Survivor (most likely all at once).
